definition: to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to dispute/to debate/to argue/to discuss
to argue endlessly/to try to have the last word

sentences.english: To argue otherwise is trying to defend the indefensible.
sentences.chinese: 持相反的論點就是試圖爲站不住腳的事情強辯。

sentences.english: Some may argue themselves out of trying their best by fantasing tomorrow's brightness.
sentences.chinese: 有些人強辯着把希望寄託於明日的光明而不努力。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance

lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to slander/to smear/to vilify
fight to the death/desperate struggle
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
shameful secret
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
